direction.raw_text: : We did not always live in hiding. We have come to the image of a huge family tree, which springs from a single seed but divides into two separate halves. On the left, ruled by the moon, the branches blossom into extraordinary creatures. On the right, by sunlight, the branches end in ordinary human beings. Upon the word Nightbreed the title comes up on the screen, against the image of a moon painted on the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deleted
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. REEDS NIGHT Cut to a real moon. Then cut wide to a moonlit landscape, through which the camera careens madly. The soundtrack, which was lush and almost sacred in the mural chamber, erupts into a tribal rhythm. We glimpse creatures in the darkness, moving through the reeds. They are barely more than silhouettes. We see teeth, and gleaming eyes; glimpses of naked, patterned flesh. Only glimpses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. MURAL CHAMBER Cut back to the mural chamber. Now we have moved away from the tree to a more brutal scene. A symbolic representation of a great apocalyptic war between Naturals and Breed. Terrible scenes of destruction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : But the Naturals made war on us. They feared us for our strength. They envied our powers. They called us monsters, killing us by whatever means their malice could invent, finding in each of us our particular vulnerability. We are scanning scenes of that war. A breed being staked like a vampire. Another being shot like a werewolf. Another exposed to sunlight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : None of us was safe. The tribes of the moon dwindled. Our gods were slaughtered, our homes destroyed. It was the Apocalypse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NECROPOLIS WALL AND GATES Cut back to the landscape. The clouds roil above the heads of the creatures heading through the reeds. We see their destination now. A huge wall, with gates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. MURAL CHAMBER And back to the mural chamber, and a final scene. The gates we've just seen are in the painting. Looking over them, calling the Breed in, is a vast indistinct form: that of Baphomet. His eyes burn; his arms are open in welcome.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Only one of our Gods survived the holocaust. Baphomet. Wounded and near death, he summoned us, the last of the last, into hiding. Into Midian, where we wait now. The battle is over but not the war. There will come a saviour. Now we've moved beyond the image of the gate into a new patch of wall on which the pictures are only vague sketches. We can interpret some of the images nevertheless: a man with a bloody hole in the middle of his chest. A man wearing a mask like a skull. We linger on a faceless figure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : His name is Cabal. He will lead and give us back the Night. We are the tribes of the moon. We are the Nightbreed. The titles end.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NECROPOLIS WALL AND GATES Cut back to the landscape. Now we are at the gates, and the creatures slip through and away into the mist. Only one, a beautiful, ferocious female called Shuna Sassi remains, turning to look at us. She beckons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Come... The camera retreats from her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Will you not come? Now the last of the creatures, the Drummer, takes her by the arm, snatching her away through the gates. As she disappears, the camera follows again, stopping at the gates themselves, which close with an unearthly din.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 2R. INT. LORI'S APARTMENT NIGHT C.U. on Boone, closed eyes. He is dreaming. His gaze roves beneath his lids. Lori's lips come into shot kissing first his eyes and then traveling down his face to his mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Boone...wake up. Boone's eyes flicker open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Hi. You OK? Boone: Yep. Now Boone's eyes are fully open. He sits up. Looks towards the open window. Night beyond. She kisses him, distracting him from the sight of the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You want something to eat?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Sure. What time is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Nine-thirty. I was letting you doze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Thought you'd worn me out, huh? Lori smiles, and kisses him, then crosses the room to the kitchen area, picks up some fruit, and a knife, carrying both back to where Boone is lying on the bed. It is unmade. Both Lori and Boone are lightly dressed, clothes casually thrown on after an afternoon lovemaking. Lori: You know what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : We should get out of Calgary for a few days. Just take off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Anywhere special?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Somewhere we can be alone together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : More alone than this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Yeah. Just you and me. No work. No telephone calls. No...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Bad dreams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : No bad dreams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : How did you know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I know. I always know. It's no big deal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I'm going around in some crazy loop in my head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You're not crazy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Say it like you mean it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I believe it. I'm not crazy. But I want this damn dream out of my head. He gets up and goes to the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Decker's started calling me again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : When?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : All last week. Every day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : What does he want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I don't know. I haven't called him back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : If he can help, see him. Tell him it's all gone but the bad dreams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : They're not bad. That's what's weird. The more I have them the more I like them. Now I do sound like a crazy, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : No. You sound like the man I love. A little haunted, maybe, but the sanest man I ever met.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Keep going.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Will you see Decker?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You think I should?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Where's the harm? You tell him from me, I'm the only thing you should be dreaming about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I don't think he'd get it. He never had a wet dream in his life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I don't want to be competing with things I can't see, Boone. Can't share I don't want to be always feeling that something's pulling at you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I'm not going anywhere, Lori. Except with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I can't hear that often enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I'll never leave you. Not ever. I swear. He kisses her, passionately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Can't remember a time when I didn't love you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : How about before we met?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Even then. They kiss again. We move past them into the darkness outside the window. Dissolve to the moon, clearing cloud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. RICKMAN HOUSE NIGHT A pleasant house in a pleasant neighborhood. Lights burn inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. RICKMAN HOUSE NIGHT Melissa Rickman emerges from the lounge, with a Dagwood sandwich, a work in progress. She is thirty-five, and going to seed in a gentle way. Her husband, Lou Rickman, a similar type, is planted in front of the television.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Okay, you want ham, cheese, pickle, mustard?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : All of the above and a brewski, thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You're getting porky, Lou.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [amiable - tried to grab her]: I'm comfortable. I like myself fat. I like you fat too...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [secretly amused - she hushes him]: Keep it down, Lou, you'll wake the munchkins. She hears something upstairs, goes to the foot of the stairs, looks up. Her eldest son, Lou Two, waddles into view. He's five.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Mommy...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Sweetie, you're supposed to be beddy-bye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I heard something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : What did you hear?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Bad man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : No, everything's okay. You go back to bed, munchkin, I'll be up to see you in a minute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [V.O.]: How's that sandwich coming?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Coming... Melissa disappears from the bottom of the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. RICKMAN KITCHEN NIGHT Melissa enters, moves out of sight. We stay at the door. A figure appears dressed in black, knives in both hands, and crosses to leave the screen again. We do not see his face. But we hear his labours: the sound of the blades slicing Melissa. She staggers into view, grabbing hold of her slit throat. Blood bubbles between her fingers. The figure appears behind her. She turns, as the knife descends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. RICKMAN LOUNGE NIGHT Lou hears a sound, rises and moves towards the kitchen door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Melissa? At the top of the stairs, Lou Two watches wide-eyed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. RICKMAN STAIRS NIGHT Lou Two's P.O.V. - We see blood running along the highway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. RICKMAN KITCHEN NIGHT Lou reaches the kitchen door and sees Melissa laid out, dead, on the kitchen table
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Oh God - GOD! Lou enters, the figure emerges from behind him. While we remain at the door watching, detached, Lou fights back, throwing himself back and forth around the kitchen. But the figure is much stronger. We glimpse its face now, it is a mask, with a zipper for a mouth and buttons for eyes, blank. Devoid of compassion, hatred or regret. A death's head, made by a mad child. Atop the stairs, Lou Two listens. His baby sister cries in her cot. He looks her way then back downstairs. The sounds cease. Silence. Terror on his face. Then the child's perfect nightmare appears at the bottom of the stairs. The figure, heavy knife in hand, starts to climb, dragging Lou's bloody body after him by the hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCENE DELETED 22A. INT. BOONE'S APARTMENT NIGHT Empty. The phone rings. We move towards the answering machine, which clicks on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [on tape]: Hi. Please leave a message.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [thru phone]: Boone, pick up will you? Boone? Are you there? Boone? Okay, so don't answer. See you tomorrow...G'night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCENE DELETED 24. EXT. RICKMAN HOUSE NIGHT Three patrol cars, an ambulance, policeman restraining a small crowd gathered outside. A n.d. sedan roars up, red bubble light flashing, and Inspector Joyce gets out and moves towards the house. He's greeted by the Medical Examiner, Dr Burton, just exiting, carrying a medical bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [bitter]: Brace yourself, Inspector.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Same profile?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Unmistakable. Doesn't miss a trick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [anguished]: Kids? Two kids?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : If it's any comfort, they went quickly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Yeah. Makes me feel a whole lot better about the sick fuck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Find this guy, Joyce. They say these guys want to be caught. I think this one likes it too much. A rookie patrolman stands on the doorstep, on the verge of tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [gently]: Let's get these tourists back, Officer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Yes sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [to Burton]: If we can't protect the kids, what the hell use are we?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCENE DELETED 26. EXT. SUNRISE The sun climbs above the horizon, behind the cityscape of Calgary. Another day begins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCENE DELETED 28. SCENE DELETED 29. INT. DR DECKER'S OFFICE DAY Close on a pile of tapes, marked with dates over a period of two years. They're on Decker's desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I've been listening to the tapes of our sessions. All two years' worth... We move from the tapes to Decker, who gets up from his desk and moves around to the other side. Boone is sitting on the other side of the desk, his posture far from relaxed. He hates this room. As Decker moves, we take in the various pictures on the walls. Dance pictures, photographs of Decker with civic dignitaries, crippled children etc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Most of my colleagues would have walked away from a case like yours. The most they would have done was drug you. But you...you intrigued me. All the talk of monsters. And Midian. Remember Midian?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : That wasn't me. I heard about Midian from other people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : But you made it part of your private mythology.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I suppose I did. It was a place of refuge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : When you imagined yourself being taken off to this invented city, to Midian, what crimes were you going to be forgiven? Boone's looking uneasy now. He wipes sweat from his upper lip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You know what I used to dream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Yes. There's a remarkable consistency in the images you see. Great detail. Almost as though the violence was real.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : They were just bad dreams. Midian doesn't exist. Monsters don't exist. DECKER: But murder does, Boone. Murder's very real. It may start in the mind, but it ends up changing to flesh and blood. He picks up the envelope we saw in his previous scene, and takes the photographs out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: Two days ago the police brought me some photographs. They wanted to know if I had any patients who might be capable of what's in these photographs. I'm going to show you them. Are you ready for that? Boone nods. Decker lays the photographs on the table. Boone picks them up. We get glimpses of what they contain. Domestic horrors. Bloody scenes of corpses caught by the camera in grotesque positions, sliced up and bleeding. Boone's breath quickens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: When you talk about murder on the tapes, I thought it was invention. Now I'm not so sure. Boone keeps staring at the pictures. The glassy eyes stare hard at him. His breathing is now rapid and shallow. One or two of the images seem to move. Bodies twitch. He drops the photographs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I didn't...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Didn't what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : They were bad dreams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : What you describe in your sessions is very specific. Houses; faces...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I don't remember.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You want to hear?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : No! Decker picks up the photographs. Boone, highly agitated, gets up and paces the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: You think I did this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Six families killed over a two year period. All within driving distance of Calgary...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [fury]: Do you think I did this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I hope to God you didn't, for both our sakes. We've come a long way together. I don't want to believe this any more than you do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : But you do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I wouldn't put us through this pain if I didn't...if I wasn't...afraid you had.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [desperate; helpless]: What do I do? God, tell me what to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I can only go so far on your behalf. Patient confidentiality's one thing. Protecting a killer is another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [breaking down]: Jesus...Jesus...Jesus... Decker returns to his desk. Puts the photographs down and picks up a vial of prescription pills. He crosses to boone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Listen to me. Take these, they'll help. Go home, and consider what we've talked about. I'm going to give you twenty-four hours to go to the police and answer their questions of your own accord. That's as long as I can give you. if you haven't complied by then, I'm afraid I'll have to tell them what I know. Boone grabs the pills.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: I can't tell you how sorry I am...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCENE DELETED 31. SCENE DELETED SCENES 32, 33 DELETED 34. INT. DECKER'S BUILDING HALLWAY DAY Boone exits into the hall, forces open the vial of pills, swallows a couple, shaking, trying to control his terror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. DECKER'S OFFICE DAY Decker sits at his desk, lifts his briefcase, opens it, tosses the folder of photographs into the case. Looking into the case he seems on the verge of some powerful emotion. Rage? Revulsion? He snaps shut the briefcase. The emotion passes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. BOONE'S APARTMENT DAY Boone enters the apartment, his eyes wild. He slams the door and closes his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MURDER PHOTOGRAPHS/BOONE'S HALLUCINATION Boone studies the photographs in his hand, and they come to life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCENE DELETED 38. SCENE DELETED 38A INT. BOONE'S APARTMENT DAY Boone opens his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCENE DELETED 39A. INT. BOONE'S BATHROOM DAY Boone chews the pills. He is now sweating and shaking violently. Boone strips off his clothes. 40. SCENE DELETED 40A. INT. BOONE'S APARTMENT AFTERNOON Boone opens his drawers and pulls out photographs, his passport etc and starts to make a pile with them. He pours lighter fuel on the pictures, and watches them burn. Sitting against the wall still sweating he takes some more pills. We see Lori's love letters burn and hear her voice speaking the words as they are consumed. Boone cries. Then he hears Lori's voice say:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Boone... Lori is sitting on the edge of the bed. Boone looks round, sees himself against the wall and moves forward past the real Boone towards the bed... Boone watches as he and Lori make love on the bed. We close in on the love-making. Lori leans to kiss him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I'll never leave you... Cut back to boone, his face all grief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Stupid. CUT TO:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. BOONE'S BATHROOM AFTERNOON Boone's hand pulls the shower curtain aside and turns on the water. The water pours on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HALLUCINATION Another of the murder scenes comes to life. Corpses pulse with hideous animation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. BOONE'S BATHROOM AFTERNOON With a cry Boone slides to the shower floor, panting, haunted, destroyed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [faintly]: ...I did it...I did it all...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. BOONE'S APARTMENT EVENING Behind him, the last of the fire flickers. He looks through the blinds at the sunset. Takes another pill. Puts on his leather jacket. Exits. The door slams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCENE DELETED 45. INT. NIGHTCLUB NIGHT Lori is on stage, sexy, vivacious, fronting a tight C & W band in a hip rendition of 'Johnny Be Angry'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. NIGHTCLUB NIGHT Lori's P.O.V. looking though the crowd in front of the stage. Lori spots Boone standing near the entrance, his face in shadow. Her eyes light up with joy as the song builds to climax. It ends. Applause, cat whistles, foot stomping. Lori's in heaven. She looks out again. Boone is gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. HIGHWAY NIGHT Boone steps into view by the side of the road, watches the traffic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. NIGHTCLUB CORRIDOR NIGHT Confused and worried, Lori stands in the empty corridor, a note Boone has left for her in her hand. Boone edges out closer to the road. Spots a huge semi with a fully loaded trailer barrelling down towards him. Lori opens the note and reads: 'Keep this. Burn the rest. All wrong.' Tears burst from Lori's eyes. Boone flings himself in front of the oncoming truck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. HOSPITAL EMERGENCY ROOM NIGHT A blaze of light. A bustling emergency receiving area. A stern nurse goes through the pockets of Boone's jackets, which is lying beside him on a gurney. His eyes are closed, face and T-shirt bloody. She fishes out the vial of pills. Boone moans, opens his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucky you're in one piece, fella.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [realizing where he is]: ...can't even kill myself...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : There's a cheerful thought. [to an approaching doctor] I don't know what kind of fuel he's using, but this guy's cruising at about 35,000 feet. The doctor takes the vial of pills, checks the label. Opens Boone's eyes, shines a penlight flash on the pupils. Boone recoils. Doctor takes his pulse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You don't hit that altitude on lithium carbonate. Let's get the prescribing doctor on the line... [finally - to Boone] Okay, we're doing all right, aren't we? Tell me, what've you been taking tonight, partner?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Lithium... The doctor opens the vial, looks at a handful of the pills.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Lithium? This isn't lithium, my friend. [to the nurse] Let's move him. Observation, let's get an IV, valium/saline, 200 milligrams percodan for pain, as needed...[quietly - hands the pills to the nurse] We'll have to call this in. She nods. With considerable effort, Boone sits up urgently and grabs the doctor's hand, holding the pills.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : What was I taking?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [patronizing]: Easy. We don't know until we run some tests. Looks like some kind of lab quality psychotropic hallucinogen. You're on what we used to call a 'bad trip' there, buddy. You relax now, you're gonna be fine. The doctor and nurse ease Boone back down onto the gurney. The doctor moves away. The nurse pulls back the curtain and rolls Boone across the hall into a semi-private room
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. SEMI-PRIVATE HOSPITAL ROOM NIGHT From emergency behind them, a warning buzzer sounds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [thru loudspeaker]: Code blue! Code blue! In an emergency room cubicle, a patient is having a seizure. The nurse rushes off, leaving Boone. Interns roll the cardiac cart towards the cubicle and curtains close around the scene. The door to Boone's room swings closed, shutting out the sounds. Boone exhales heavily. Closes his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [V.O.] [muttering - half mumbled ranting]: Shit! Shit! Take me, why don't you take me? Boone opens his eyes. Looks across the room at Narcisse, a wild man, half-derelict, half-punk, bloodied, his hand bandaged, pacing back and forth like a caged cat, staring out of a large picture window at the night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. HOSPITAL WINDOW NIGHT Looking in at the brightly lit window framed in the dark building, as Narcisse restlessly moves across it, peering outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. SEMI-PRIVATE HOSPITAL ROOM NIGHT NARCISSE [low and anxious]: They've gone, they've gone, they were here, they were coming for me, where'd they go? Shit!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Hey...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [turns on him - viciously]: Shut up, shut up! They saw you, they won't come while you're here, they won't show themselves to the likes of you, don't you see that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [placating - knows the type]: Sure, okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Shit! I've missed them, I've missed them! You scared them off, you kept them from me! Narcisse paces again, starting to sob and sniffle. Boone leans back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.] [barely audible - between cries]: ...Midian...Midian... Boone's eyes open like a shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : What did you say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I said shut up, you want to ruin everything? Boone leaps to his feet, grabs and easily overpowers the smaller man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : What did you say, just now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [suddenly friendly]: What did you say, just now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You said Midian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [coyly]: Did I? Maybe...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [hurting him - desperate]: What do you know about it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : It's where the monsters go. It takes away the pain... Narcisse reaches his hands into his pockets, then comes out with long, silver, razor-sharp artificial nails, curved like hooks, attached to his thumbs. He holds them right at Boone's throat, ready to cut. He smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: ...what do you know about it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [pause; cautiously]: They forgive you there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Uh-huh. Ever kill anybody?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : See, they only take you if you're worthy. You know what they do to those that aren't worthy? Boone shakes his head. Narcisse draws one razor-nail lightly across his own throat. A thin trickle of blood runs down his neck. He chuckles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : It's real. Midian's real. [Narcisse nods; carefully] And you know...where it is. Don't you? We could go there...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : They sent you. They sent you to take me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : That's right. But first I need to know...you have to tell me...where it is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : It's a test? [Boone nods; Narcisse leans in to him - whispers] No maps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : But you do know. Don't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [looks around; leans in again]: North of Athabasca. East of Peace River. Near Shere Neck, north of Dwyer. Satisfied, Boone releases him, go back to the bed, collects his jacket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.] [ exhilarated]: You'll take me with you, I'm worthy, you ask anyone, I knew you'd come, they sent you to take me, I was waiting. I know, I know, first I have to show you, that's how it works. Boone is looking out of the window in the door, sizing up his escape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Show me what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : My true face. That's what there are for. [he raises his bladed thumbs] So you can see. I'm not a natural man. Underneath I'm a monster, that's how it works; I show you, then you take me with you... He puts the blade to either side of his face. We hear the skin pop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : NO! Blood pours from Narcisse's face, as he traces the outline of his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. EMERGENCY ROOM NIGHT Dr Decker, who's just arrived with Lieutenant Joyce and two policemen, is speaking with the doctor that examined Boone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [urgent - showing Boone's file]: ...he was an abandoned child, raised by the state, first diagnosis of incipient schizophrenia at thirteen, juvenile delinquency, periodically institutionalized through early adulthood...some violent episodes, never criminally charged as an adult, he's been in my care for less than a year... A bloodcurdling scream from the semi-private room rivets the attention of the emergency room
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. SEMI-PRIVATE ROOM NIGHT Following the nurse and an intern as they burst into the room and are greeted with the sight of Narcisse, blood running freely, ripping the least of his scalp off his bare skull, laughing and crying maniacally. Boone stands near the door, horrified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [variously]: TAKE ME! TAKE ME! I'M A MONSTER! Nurse [over - to Boone] What the hell have you done? Boone: Nothing!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Fucking junkies! [at the door - yelling into the corridor] Doctor! As the door swings open, Boone looks out into the corridor and at the far end of the emergency room he sees Decker and the cops looking his way. Medical support move towards the room, as the nurse and intern try to contain the ranting Narcisse. Boone grabs a loose doctor's coat off the back of the door, slips it on and backs out of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Let's get some help in here! Pandemonium. Narcisse screams, as a half-dozen people struggle to subdue him. As help continues to rush into the room, Boone slowly backs away, out and around a corner. He stops beside a swinging door, sensing something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. SEMI-PRIVATE ROOM NIGHT Dr Decker moving through emergency towards the melee, stops on the other side of the swinging door, his senses lit up with alarm. He slowly turns to the door. Pushes it open. Empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. HOSPITAL NIGHT Boone moves rapidly away from the exit into the parking lot, tossing off the white coat, breaking into a run. He tries several car doors, finds one open, gets in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. CAR NIGHT With a rush of adrenal intensity, Boone expertly rips open an under panel of the dash, locates and patches together the correct ignition wires and hot-starts the car. Closes the door. Puts it in gear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. HOSPITAL PARKING LOT INT. CAR NIGHT Boone slowly drives out of the lot trying not to attract the attention of the fleet of patrol cars sirens wailing, pouring into the area.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. FREEWAY NIGHT Boone drives up an entrance ramp and onto the highway, past a sign that reads:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. HOSPITAL EMERGENCY WARD NIGHT Dr Decker, a few policeman and medical personnel wait outside the door leading to the semi-private room. Lieutenant Joyce exits and a surgeon follows a moment later.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : What's he saying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : He's talking but he's not making any sense. Something about a place called Midian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : He's dying. I think he wants to die. Pause. The surgeon moves on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [unobtrusively - to Joyce]: Lieutenant, I know Boone, I know how he talks, how he manipulates. Perhaps if the right thing is said to this man it'll trigger something...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [consider]: No harm in trying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I'll do my best. But I'll need privacy. Decker enters the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. SEMI-PRIVATE ROOM NIGHT Looking in through the room, we see Decker cross the room to the bed where Narcisse is lying. Decker says something to the nurse. She exits. Decker moves closer to the bed. He reaches into his pocket for something and moves out of our sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. HIGHWAY/INT. CAB NIGHT/DAY Montage - Boone drives through the night, and the following day, through a landscape which becomes increasingly more desolate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. ROAD SIGN LATE AFTERNOON The road sign reads:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - 56 MILES' Boone's car speeds past.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. DIRT ROAD OUTSIDE MIDIAN DAY Boone's car rolls to a stop. Boone steps out and looks at something in the dust. A battered sign. It reads:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is no sign of life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : No....oh no...[in despair] No! His shout echos. The wind blows up a cloud of dust around him. He walks through the dust, on the verge of tears. And then...the dust clears, and he sees...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NECROPOLIS DAY Necropolis, lying on the other side of a thick expanse of reeds. Puzzlement overtakes despair. He squints to see more clearly... The Necropolis is vast. High walls, surrounded by reeds, with the tops of mausoleums, showing above it. ALmost a fortressed town. Boone starts towards it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NECROPOLIS GATES DAY The sun is low in the sky, the light golden glinting off the gates. The reeds sigh. Boone pushes one of the gates open and steps inside. His footsteps echo, unnaturally loud in this city of the dead. To either side of him, elegant and elaborate mausoleums, running away into the distance, with numerous smalls tombs set around and between them. The sun finally sinks out of sight. Its final glow dies on the tops of the mausoleums. There are already stars overhead. Boone walks on a little way, as the night sounds begin. Exhausted, he sits down on a tomb and leans back against the stone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [softly - a bitter irony]: Dead ... all of the dead ... He rummages for a cigarette in his jacket pocket. Pulls one out. Lights it. The flame seems to excite sounds around him. He looks up. The walkways are empty in both directions. There's a guttural sound at his back. He stands, drops the cigarette, backs away. From the darkness behind him steps a huge form. A knife is put to his lower belly. Its wielder, Kinski, is a massive man, face distorted, his features grotesquely bifurcated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [whispers]: Move and I gut you. Boone stays still. The growling from between the tombs becomes words.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [from the darkness]: You got him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I got him. A reptilian hand reaches out and picks up Boone's dropped cigarette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Midian? Are you from Midian?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : We should take him below, Peloquin. The silhouette of Peloquin, a were-creature, moves between the tombs. He draws on the cigarette. By its brightening point we glimpse an extraordinary face: more animal than human, but no recognizable species.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : He's not Nightbreed. He's Natural.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : No! I've killed people, I'm like you, that's why I'm here...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Shut the fuck up. You're meat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : If we eat him we break the Law.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : My God...my God, it's true ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Of course it's true. Everything's true ... [he starts to emerge from the shadows] God's an astronaut. Oz is over the rainbow. And Midian's where the monsters live. And you came to die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I didn't...didn't come to die. I came to be with you, I'm one of you. Peloquin reaches out and touches Boone's chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : No. Sorry. I can smell innocence at fifty yards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I've killed people. Fifteen people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Who told you that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : He lied, asshole. He lied. You're a Natural. And that means...you're meat for the Beast. Peloquin growls, throwing his head back and forth with a strange grace, the image flickering as he does so. Boone watches, amazed. In the blur of Peloquin's motion he transforms, the tentacles on his head lengthening and thickening, thrashing around as though they have a life of their own. He moves towards Boone, taking hold of him and tearing his T-shirt open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : We mustn't. It's the Law. They'll exile us...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Fuck the Law! I want meat! He bites Boone's neck, tearing at his flesh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Peloquin, no! Kinski takes the knife from Boone's belly and pushes Peloquin aside. Boone slips away from them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Damn you! He races after Boone, who runs blindly, his hand pressed to the wound on his neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NECROPOLIS NIGHT The Breed listen. We track running feet past the grille, and move close into grille, dropping through a dark rock face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCENE DELETED 67A. INT. BELOW MIDIAN In the deep darkness faces look up. The faces are strange and freakish. There is a woman locked in the embrace of a dark monster. A monstrous baby cries.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NECROPOLIS NIGHT Boone takes refuge against a mausoleum wall. He takes his hand from the wound on his neck. It is throbbing like a living thing, spreading across his muscle. He stares down at the wound, then touches it lightly. It gives him pleasure. A sound above him. He looks up. Peloquin is climbing down the mausoleum wall, mouth opened wide to take off Boone's head. Boone throws himself forward as the jaws snap shut, missing him by inches. He runs. Kinski appears in his path. For an instant Boone thinks the game's up...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : That way! The gate's that way! Boone sprints.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. BELOW MIDIAN The monsters watch and listen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NECROPOLIS GATES NIGHT Peloquin pushes Kinski aside and pelts after Boone, who is at the gate. He flings himself through, and slams it behind him. Peloquin is at the gate, when Kinski comes up behind and restrains him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : He's gone, give it up! You don't dare go out there! Peloquin stares at Boone through the gate. Panting, sweating, Boone stares back. Snorting with frustration, Peloquin recedes, he and Kinski disappear into shadow. Boone heaves a sigh of relief, turns from the gate and trudges away into the darkness, when suddenly . . .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. OUTSIDE NECROPOLIS GATES NIGHT Harsh lights hit Boone from every side; police cars in the reeds all around, their searchlights focused on him. Two dozen cops, all levelling firearms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Freeze! Right there! Boone squints against the glare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: Aaron Boone, you're under arrest. Hands on your head!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Boone takes a step back. The wound on his neck throbs and swells. At the edge of the light, Decker appears, stepping towards him. DECKER: Boone, listen to him, it's no use!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [to Decker]: Stay back!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [lowers his voice]: Lieutenant, I can bring him out. He'll listen to me. Joyce ponders, then signals him forward. Decker advances toward Boone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: Boone, it's all right, I've explained everything to them. Rifles are cocked on every side. Decker stops a safe distance from Boone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: They won't harm you, I give you my word.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [hanging back]: I didn't do it. I didn't hurt anyone...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [lowering his voice]: Of course you didn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You...you believe me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You wouldn't hurt a fly. [extends a hand] Come on, Boone. It's safe, I've seen to that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [taking a tentative step forward]: What, what about the pills?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [pause; whispers]: What about them, Boone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : They weren't tranquillizers... A look of alarm crosses Decker's face. Boone reads it. He gets the picture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: You set me up...you bastard, you set me up! He lunges for Decker, who turns and throws himself to the ground as he yells.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : He's got a gun!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : FIRE! The bullets fly. Boone is about to pounce on Decker when he's hit by a barrage, thrown back, riddled with bullets. On the ground, Decker covers his head. Boone goes down. The volley ends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NECROPOLIS NIGHT The sound of gunfire echoes through the walkways.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. BELOW MIDIAN In the shadows, a baby held in the arms of a woman with monstrous but beautiful features, begins to cry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. OUTSIDE MIDIAN NIGHT Joyce hears the sound of crying and looks up. Boone's body lies on the ground. Decker rises, hearing the distant sobs on the wind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. BELOW MIDIAN The mother hushes the child, her arms, which are tentacles, wrapping around it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. OUTSIDE MIDIAN NIGHT The sound of crying is lost. Joyce moves forward, towards Decker and Boone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [trying to convince himself]: ...just the wind. He reaches Decker, looks down at Boone's body. Looks around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: Where's the gun?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [seemingly dismayed]: He reached into his jacket...I thought I saw it, I swear...oh God, Boone...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [quietly, to some cops, meaning Boone]: Get him outta here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NECROPOLIS NIGHT We track towards a tomb, on which the epitaph reads: 'GOD IS MERCIFUL' FADE OUT:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. MORGUE/VIEWING ROOM NIGHT Moving with Lori, flanked by Dr Burton the pathologist, and a grim Joyce. They enter a smaller room. Burton flips a switch. Curtains part in front of a thick glass panel, revealing a small, sterile viewing chamber. In the chamber are a morgue attendant and, lying on a stainless steel table, Boone's body. Lori looks at the body with heartbreaking sadness. She nods. Burton closes the curtains. Lori and Joyce exit. On the other side of the glass, the attendant rolls Boone on the table towards a door marked 'Pathology'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. INTERVIEW ROOM NIGHT Dr Decker sits alone, looking into his briefcase. The door opens, Lori and Joyce enter. Decker closes the briefcase, rises, aggrieved, takes both of Lori's hands in his, speaks soothingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Lori, I'm Dr Decker. Boone was my patient.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Yes. Hello.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I'm so sorry for your loss. I must tell you, you meant the world to Aaron. He spoke of you constantly ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [withdrawing her hand - has the creeps]: Thank you, Doctor. Lori sits across a table from Joyce. Decker sits against the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Miss Winston, are you sure you wouldn't rather postpone...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : No. Let's get it over with. Joyce turns on a tape recorder on the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [starting at the beginning]: What was your relationship with Aaron Boone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [pause]: We were lovers. We move in on the revolving reels of the tape recorder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : How long had you known Aaron Boone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Two months.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. AUTOPSY ROOM NIGHT Burton and the attendant, instruments laid out, Boone's body on a brightly lit steel table, ready for the autopsy. Burton activates an overhead microphone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Deceased is a white Caucasian male, late twenties. Suspected cause of death, multiple gunshot wounds to the thoracic cavity and extremities. The attendant lifts up Boone's jacket. Light streams through many bullet holes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Jesus. They weren't takin' any chances. Burton picks up a small digging tool and zeroes in on one of the chest wounds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Wound number one: entered between the fourth and fifth left ribs, impacted the lower rib, lodging in ligaments adjacent to the left lung ... He digs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. INTERVIEW ROOM NIGHT JOYCE: So he never gave any indication ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Surely there must have been something ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [firm, angry]; Look, you can say whatever you want to about him. I don't believe it. He never raised a hand to me, he never harmed anyone in his life. A strained silence. Decker drums his fingers on his briefcase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Miss Winston, everyone has their secret faces ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Drop dead. Annoyed at Decker, Joyce turns off the tape recorder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : We'll continue this some other time. Lori stands and heads for the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. AUTOPSY ROOM NIGHT A pair of callipers drop a distended bullet into a steel bowl, containing at least ten other similarly maimed bullets. Fatigued with effort, Burton wipes his forehead, turns off the microphone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Coffee break. The attendant turns off the bright overheads, he and Burton move into an adjoining lounge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. MORGUE ENTRY WAY NIGHT Lori is putting on her coat. A contrite Decker approaches her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Miss Winston, I hope you didn't misinterpret what I said. Boone meant a great deal to me ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Where did he die? [pause] What was the name of the town?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : A place called Midian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCENE DELETED 85. INT. AUTOPSY ROOM NIGHT The bowl wobbles on the ground. The bullets roll off in different directions. Sound of glass breaking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. MORGUE ENTRY WAY NIGHT Hearing the breaking glass, Lori and Decker turn back towards the autopsy room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Boone? She runs towards the sound, Decker follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. MORGUE NIGHT In slow motion, a large first-floor window shatters out towards us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. AUTOPSY ROOM NIGHT As Lori, then Decker enter, moments after Burton, Joyce and the attendant. The autopsy table is empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Someone's taken him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : My God...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [looking around]: Where's his coat?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. MORGUE NIGHT Slow motion  distorting time, we see the rest of the shattering window and a dim figure crosses the moon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. LORI'S APARTMENT DAY Lori hurriedly throws some belongings into a suitcase. We see some newspaper clippings beside the suitcase. A headline reads: 'SLASHER SUSPECT SLAIN' Another features a map, showing the location of Midian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. ROAD DAY Montage - Lori drives, at high speed, down the same roads Boone took previously.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: 'WELCOME TO SHERE NECK/WELCOME BUFFALO DAYS RODEO' 93

direction.raw_text: . EXT. SHERE NECK ROAD EVENING At sunset, Lori enters the town, past a sign that reads: 'WELCOME TO SHERE NECK/WELCOME BUFFALO DAYS RODEO' 93. EXT. SHERE NECK MOTEL EVENING Lori pulls into the parking lot of the motel. A neon sign reads:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Above it, the moon. From the motel itself, sounds of revelry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. MOTEL BAR NIGHT A wood-panelled, Western Frontier-themed bar. Country music. A banner welcomes rodeo participants. A number of rough types clustered at tables, many of them wearing baseball caps adorned with buffalo horns. Lori enters, looks around. A cowboy lassoes a waitress, ropes her in to general applause. Lori takes a seat at the bar and is approached by a bartender.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : What'll it be, darlin'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : A draft and some information please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [taps a stein of draft]: There's the draft.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [lays down a bill]: I'm looking for a town called Midian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You're not the first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : No?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Had a bunch of TV news folks passin' through, since they nailed that baby-slasher up there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Baby-slasher?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Yeah, hell of a week for us. The rodeo this weekend. That scumbag gets blown away. I hear it took thirty slugs to bag that sucker. Just goes to show you, don't it? People love a spectacle. Lori's hit with a burst of emotion. She doesn't want the bartender to see her cry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Where's the bathroom?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Right around the corner there, darlin'. Lori rises, exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. MOTEL BATHROOM DAY Lori enters and leans on the sink as the grief hits her. She sobs. A stall door opens behind her: Sheryl, a girl in her early twenties, exits. Lori pulls a tissue from her bag and tries to compose herself, standing back to allow Sheryl access to the mirror, where she studied herself before starting to tease her hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Which is it, hon', men or money? [Lori looks at her] It's usually one or the other, ain't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Oh...[a tiny smile]...A man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Uh-huh. What'd he do, leave?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Not exactly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Jesus, did he come back? That's even worse. In spite of herself, Lori's brightened by the girl's good humor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: Some loser takes a shine to ya, you could toss 'em in the river tied to a piano he'll come back faster than a dog with a bone. Thing is, why go to all this trouble to look so good if there's nobody to admire the end product, am I right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Can't argue with that, [likes her, feeling lonely] Can I buy you a drink?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Hell, yes you can. Better than gettin' hit on by some damn buffalo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. MOTEL BAR NIGHT Lori and Sheryl at the bar. Lori's nursing a beer. Sheryl's into her fourth Black Russian and is getting friendlier by the moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [pause - just heard the story]: Lord. I have seen men go to great lengths to walk out on a girl. But, I must say, I have never heard tell of a fella doin' it while deceased.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : They think some sick bastard's stole the body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : So you want to go check out the place in which he checked out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Yeah. Guess it's a way to say goodbye, you know? He was always a mystery to me. I loved him...[she looks away]
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Tell you what, Lori, why don't I drive up there to this Medium place with you tomorrow and keep you company?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You don't have to do that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Yeah, but I'm goin' to and I don't want no argument from you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [smiles, grateful]: Okay. Thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : That's all right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [finishes her beer]: Guess I'll head up to my room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You get some rest, sugar. I'm gonna stay down here and close this damn bar. Maybe one of these lunkheads'll win the lottery. Lori smiles, squeezes her hand, exits the bar. Sheryl looks around, finishes her drink. The bartender sets another drink down in front of her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Courtesy of that gent in the suit at the end of the bar. Sheryl looks down the bar, sees the man, seems impressed, waves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [low, to the bartender]: Isn't he just the picture of sophistication though?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NECROPOLIS NIGHT We Cut to a wide shot of the Necropolis by night. A shooting star falls. Now we move in on one of the mausoleums, and from the ground below we hear a ritualistic chanting. Once within the darkness of the mausoleum the camera slides down over the rock face into the depths of Midian. The volume of the chanting increases as we come close to its source.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. MURAL CHAMBER We come into the mural chamber, the camera passing down over the family tree of Naturals and Nightbreed and round to see Rachel and Kinski approaching and entering the door of the initiation chamber. Cut to Narcisse and Boone, also approaching the chamber.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You'll like this. No, really. It's just their way of welcoming you to the club.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I'm not sure I want to be a member.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You made your way back here for the same reasons I did. We belong here now. There's nowhere else on earth would take us in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. INITIATION CHAMBER In the middle of the chamber is a kind of font, on which stands a bowl of Baphomet's blood, steaming and bubbling. Standing in front of it is Lylesburg. To his side Peloquin. Beside him, Rachel. On Lylesburg's other side, Ohnaka. Standing around the walls as witnesses to the ceremony, are a variety of Breed. Boone enters. The Breed all look his way. Boone sees Shuna Sassi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [to Narcisse in a whisper]: Who is she?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Shuna Sassi. Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I dreamt her. Shuna leans towards Peloquin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I've dreamt him. Narcisse nudges Boone forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Who is your advocate?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Have you tutored him in the Law?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Yes he has.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Let the advocate answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Yes I have.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You understand what you do, becoming one of us? With this night you turn your back on the Natural World. The life you lived will after this be as a dream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I know. Lylesburg takes the glove off his right hand. The flesh beneath is cauterized.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The blood of the God tells all truths. It can harm as easily as heal. Are you prepared to be judged?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I'm ready. Lylesburg nods, and puts his hand into the bowl of the blood. The blood bubbles around his wrist. We cut to Peloquin and Shuna Sassi, who are watching Boone intently. Boone's eyes are now on Lylesburg's smoking hand as it approaches Boone's chest, still marked by his wounds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Be judged. He puts his hand on the bullet wounds. Boone stiffens. But there's no pain. When Lylesburg's hand is removed, the wounds have gone. There's a visible release of tension on the faces of all those watching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Aaron Boone, in the name of Baphomet, Lord of the tribes of the moon, I bid you welcome... The camera moves out of the chamber, and towards the mural.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. MOTEL BEDROOM NIGHT Lori lies awake in bed, staring at the ceiling. Outside, and next door, the noise of laughter and partying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [quietly, a tear in her eye]: I still love you, Boone...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. MOTEL BAR DAY Sheryl is sitting at the empty bar, obviously hung over. She is wearing dark glasses and a horned Buffalo Days hat. The bartender pours her an eye-opener.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Hair of the dog. Lori enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Hi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : How's your head?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : My momma always used to say, 'Sheryl Ann, there's a man out walking around with your name on his mind, all you got to do is run into him.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : And he just happened to be checked in here at the crossroads of the world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Isn't that something? His name is Curtis, he is a banker, recently divorced and recently relocated in Edmonton, up for the rodeo and better yet, he thinks I am the Queen-bee's knees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Sheryl, you sure you want to come along?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Wouldn't miss it. Besides, Curtis has to do business today, we've got an engagement for this evening and if I sit around all day with this head on I'm gonna feel like the hind end of a dog sled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I'm glad for your company.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Now if we could just make a quick stop for some Alka-Seltzer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCENE DELETED 100. EXT. MIDIAN/INT. LORI'S CAR DAY Lori's car comes to a stop near the edge of the reeds outside the Necropolis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Jesus. Looks like the gold rush is over. Lori parks the car. She gets out, looks around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [quiet - reflective]: Why? Why would Boone come here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : To get away from it all? [Lori gives her a look] Shut up, Sheryl Ann. You go do what you have to do. I'll stay here and...do somethin' else. Lori nods and heads away down the street, leaving Sheryl beside the car. She leans against the car, surveys the emptiness, without enthusiasm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: My luck, I'll end up buying some real estate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. MIDIAN DAY Lori - as she leaves the reeds and sees the outer walls of the Necropolis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Good God...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. MIDIAN DAY Sheryl - wandering from the car into the reeds. She lights a cigarette, tunelessly humming to ward off the willies. She stops, shivers, suddenly feeling very isolated. The atmosphere's got to her. She starts back to the car. She catches some movement out of the corner of her eye. Stops. Slowly walks away from the movement, fighting off panic. She turns a corner, and realizes she's lost in the reeds. She hears movement behind her, turns, startled, then, oddly, she smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Curtis ... what are you doing here? It's Decker, looking like a commuter, hair slicked back, wearing an overcoat, carrying his briefcase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [big smile]: Hello, Sheryl Ann.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NECROPOLIS GATES DAY Lori reaches the gates, slightly breathless. She pushes one of them open. The sun is hot and bright, transforming the Necropolis from the dark, dangerous place it was when Boone was here. Now, with its gothic tombs and burgeoning plant life, it's almost welcoming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NECROPOLIS DAY Lori wanders the walkways, enchanted by the splendor of the place. There are strange, bittersweet sights along the way: statues of dogs sleeping on their masters' graves; of mourning mothers; of children, sitting at their graves. And grotesque images too: gargoyles protecting the doorways of mausoleums; a tiger, roaring in stone. It is another world, solemn and silent. Except...suddenly, the sound of an animal in pain. Lori stops and looks around. Her gaze comes to rest on a spreading laurel tree beneath which the shadows are pitch black. From here, the sobbing comes. She approaches. There is an animal beneath the tree, barely discernible. She can see its flanks panting, its head moving in pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Jesus... It doesn't look like a recognizable species, an amalgam of wild cat and deer. She approaches. It raises its head, weakly. Its eyes are huge and black.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: ...It's okay, I won't hurt you...it's okay... The creature shudders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: ...What's happened to you?...Let me see. She reaches beneath the branches and tentatively strokes the animal. It responds by dropping its head back on to the grass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: Oh God...you poor thing...don't die, please don't die. She pushes beneath the tree, puts her arms beneath the creature and picks it up. It is heavy, a dead weight in her arms. She backs out from beneath the tree. As she steps back into the sun, the creature snarls and starts to wither in her arms. She realizes what's causing it pain and steps back into shadow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: You don't like the sun? Is that it? The sound of sobbing, off to her left, draws her attention. One of the mausoleum doors is open, and a woman, Rachel, dressed in black, stands in the shadows, weeping. Lori's astonished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: I'm sorry...is, is it yours?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Bring her. Bring her, please. Shading the creature from the sun, Lori moves to the door and steps into the gloom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. MAUSOLEUM DAY The interior is marble, the air murky. Rachel, a fine-boned, pre- Raphaelite beauty in her thirties, moves back against the far wall, nursing a wounded arm. Lori looks down at the creature she's carrying, utterly limp in her arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : ...I'm afraid it's too late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : No...she can't die. Bring her to me, please. Rachel reaches out. Lori's reluctant to move further into the darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Hurry! As Lori crosses the floor, she hears whispering from a stairway that leads down into the earth. She stops, frightened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Pay no attention. Please, bring me my Babette. As the creature is named it starts to move in Lori's arms. Not only move, but change. Its claws grab at Lori's breast as it writhes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: Babette, no!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : What's happening?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Don't look! Don't look! But Lori can't help but look. Appalled, she tries to pull the transforming creature off her, but its hold is firm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Jesus! Jesus! With effort, she detaches the creature's claws from her, almost throwing it at Rachel, who cradles the changing creature in her arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Babette... Lori leans against the wall, trying to wipe the sticky fluids the creature's exuded onto her hands. When she looks up she sees the creature in Rachel's arms has transformed into a pale, beautiful girl of seven or eight. Lori's dumbstruck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : What...what...what the...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : She likes to play outside. I tell her: you mustn't play in the sun. The sun will hurt you. But she's just a child. She doesn't understand. Lori looks back towards the open door, and the sun-drenched walkway outside. Then back at Babette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : This is too weird.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [an urgent whisper]: You saved her. I owe you something...listen; I know why you came here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You must go, this place is not for you. Midian is a home for the Nightbreed. Only for the Nightbreed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Is Boone here? Did somebody bring him here? A deep baritone voice rises up from the shadows of the stairwell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Rachel...you have said too much already. Lylesburg appears, a commanding, magisterial man with a vast grey beard and three slits on each cheek that look like gills. Loping along beside him, his fool, a muscular man with an innocently beautiful face: Ohnaka.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : My Lylesburg, she brought me Babette, she saved her . . .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : We know. But you cannot help her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [her spunk surfacing]: Look, I saved the child's life, don't I deserve something for that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The child has no life to save, [he looks at her - sizes her up] But what she has is yours, if you want it. That's the Law. Do you want her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : No! I just want some answers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You weren't meant to see this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I kind of got that impression.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Then you also understand that to speak of this to anyone will bring dire consequences . . .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Hey, pal, don't threaten me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Not for you. For us. His words take the edge off Lori's anger. She notices that inscribed in the marble arch above the doorway are the words:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: What's below remains below. This is the Law. Rachel is carrying Babette down the steps. Lylesburg turns to follow her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Wait! Wait a minute! Boone, Aaron Boone, just tell me, is he here? You took him, you took his body, didn't you? Hey! Lori crosses to the stairs. Lylesburg's disappeared down into the darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: Talk to me, damn it, I have to know - come back!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. MAUSOLEUM STAIRWELL Lori heads down the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Come back! Lylesburg, Ohnaka, Rachel and Babette have gone, however. Lori continues her descent. There are sounds in the darkness below her. She stops, and looks back towards the top of the stairs. It's a long way off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [to herself]: How deep does this go? She heads on down, turning a corner. In front of her, Peloquin. He starts towards her. She backs away, into a second creature, and starts up the stairs. As she does so a third creature swings down from the darkness above her head. She shrieks, and runs like hell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [calls after her]: Come back soon, y'hear?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NECROPOLIS DAY Lori emerges, squinting against the blinding sun, trying to calm herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Okay. Walk away, Lori. Don't panic. There's got to be a perfectly reasonable explanation, [can't sustain it] And hell if I know what it is. She sprints back towards the gate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. MIDIAN DAY Out of breath, Lori reaches the car, parked where she left it. No sign of Sheryl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Sheryl! Sheryl! Let's get the hell out of here! [no reply] Sheryl? Lori looks around. Sees Sheryl's purse in the dirt near the reeds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: Sheryl? She moves towards the reeds. Picks up the purse. Peers inside the house. She hears a gurgling laugh from inside. It could be Sheryl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: Sheryl, come on ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. REEDS DAY The undergrowth is dark and empty. Lori advances cautiously through the paths.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Sheryl, we have to go, uh, something's kind of come up and... She sees a splash of blood on the reeds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: Oh shit. . . Something moves across our field of vision in the gloom behind her. She turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: Sheryl? She turns back and follows the trail of blood around the corner, Lying on the floor is Sheryl. Mouth cut away. Tongue cut off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: Jesus! God! She turns to run, but Decker steps into her path. He wears a mask of repulsive simplicity: a linen face with two buttons for eyes and a zipper [open at present] for a mouth. In his hands are two large carving knives, both blood-stained.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Let's get it over with, shall we?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [mind racing, a survivor]: Take it easy, let's talk about this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [advancing]: Don't try and reason with me, Lori. I'm a lunatic. You don't reason with lunatics.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : How do you know my name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Good question. No reason why you shouldn't have an answer. [he pulls off the mask] Wish I had a camera. Oh, the look a your face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Why? Why did you kill her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Why did I kill all the others? For the fun of it, of course. For pleasure. Everyone ought to have a hobby, don't you agree?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Boone was innocent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Is innocent, wherever he's hiding. After all the trouble I went to to find him a home for his guilt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You sick motherfucker...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Boone's alive, Lori. And your death is going to bring him out of hiding. He comes at her suddenly, but his heel slides in Sheryl's blood. He falls in front of Lori, and stabs at her feet. She avoids the stab by an inch. He rises suddenly, throws one of his knives aside and grabs the blade Lori holds, with a glove which strikes sparks. It is chainmail. Lori lets go, propelling herself through the reeds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCENE DELETED 110. INT. NECROPOLIS LATE AFTERNOON The light is diminishing behind the Necropolis walls. Lori's screams are distant. We track towards the gate as she runs down the hill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Somebody help me! She flings the gate open and enters. Decker emerges from the reeds behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCENE DELETED 111A. INT. THE TEMPLE OF BAPHOMET The temple is an impressive chamber, at the centre of which is a dais, ringed with representatives of the six failed saviours of Breed. In the middle of the ring, a statue of Baphomet. There are benches along the walls. Sitting in them, reciting in soft, sibilant voices the Laws of Midian, are Breed. Lylesburg, accompanied by Ohnaka, is also in the chamber, as is Boone, being held by the Breed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I have to help her!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You can't go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I'll kill him. No-one will ever know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : What's below remains below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I can't let her die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : When we took you in you made an oath to obey the Law.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I won't listen to him butcher her. I love her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : She's a Natural. She couldn't love you back. Not now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Wrong! He starts to struggle against his captors, fighting them off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You're wrong! Throwing one back, and punching the other, Boone breaks for the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Boone! Boone! Lylesburg's shout is ignored, as Boone heads up to the surface.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NECROPOLIS LATE AFTERNOON Lori runs down the walkways pursued by Decker, her breath coming in gasps, close to collapse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Help me! Oh please, God, somebody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCENE DELETED 114. EXT. NECROPOLIS LATE AFTERNOON Lori collapses. Decker reaches her and pulls on his mask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : That's good. Be still. It's quicker that way. He pulls a particularly nasty blade from his jacket interior and advances. She rises and tries to duck the cut. He strikes her with the back of his hand. She falls, striking her head on a tomb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.] [sudden fury]: I said, be still! Lori is semi-conscious, blood running from her wounded head. Looking past Decker, she sees something...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Boone... Decker laughs. Then he realizes she's reacting to the appearance of Boone, standing in the shadows behind him, in jeans and leather jacket. Lori slips into unconsciousness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You? Here again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Isn't this where the dead are supposed to go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You're not dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [advancing]: You're wrong. We're both dead, Decker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I'm not Decker!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : No? Isn't that you, Dr Decker, hiding behind that child's mask?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I'm not hiding...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [still advancing, taunting him]: Decker, Decker. Doctor Decker. Enraged, Decker throws the knife; it buries in the middle of Boone's chest. Decker laughs, then stops, as Boone pulls the knife out and tosses it aside.
direction.name: direction
