direction.raw_text: [cont.]: Blades are no better than bullets, Decker, don't you get it? I'm dead. The walking dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : That's not possible. Decker turns to run, but Boone races to him, catches, turns him and pulls Decker closer, until they're nose to nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Not just dead...changed. A monster. Want me to show you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [whimpering]: No, please ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Not your kind of monster. Not the soulless kind. I've got Midian in my veins. He tears off the mask, uncovering Decker's sweaty, terrified face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Please, please, it's, it's not my fault, it's the mask, it makes me do things I don't want to...[Boone pulls him closer] Boone, it was the mask and they were going to find me, punish me, I needed a scapegoat...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You chose the wrong man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [V.O.]: Man? You call yourself a man? Boone looks round; Narcisse is squatting on a tomb, his face a mass of scar tissue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: You're no more man than I am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Monster, then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : That's more like it. [he jumps off the tomb, moves towards them] Well, go on, are you going to kill him or not? Only I want his balls. And his eyes. That is, if you don't want them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I'll pass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Remember me, Doctor? I was dying when you had your way with me. You made me tell my secrets when I was feeling particularly vulnerable. Now was that a nice thing for a doctor to do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [to Boone, craven]: Oh God, Boone, don't let him touch me, anything, keep him off me, full confession...sweet Jesus, mercy, mercy, please, I'm begging you! Narcisse raises his thumbs, still bearing their silver hooks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Let's start with his eyes ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : No! Boone pushes Narcisse back, but as he does so Decker slips his grasp. Boone roars and starts to twitch and stamp as Peloquin did and we watch as... Boone transforms into something part man, part carnivore...and gives chase. Decker nears the gate, but Boone is after him at great speed, leaping over tombs like a high-jumper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NECROPOLIS LATE AFTERNOON Left behind, Narcisse turns his eyes upon the recumbent Lori.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [filled with hunger, greatly consoled): Well...you'll do. As he advances on her, Lori's eyes flicker open. She screams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NECROPOLIS LATE AFTERNOON Boone right on Decker's tail; he hears Lori's screams and stops. Decker runs out through the gate. Boone starts back towards Lori.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NECROPOLIS LATE AFTERNOON Lori struggling in Narcisse's arms. He tries to muffle her. Boone leaps tombs, nearing their location. He bounds into the clearing, sees Lori unconscious in Narcisse's embrace. BOONE: Let her go! Narcisse, all sheepish co-operation, gently lets her go onto the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Just...keeping her warm. Boone is almost human now. He reaches Lori.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: I wouldn't have touched her. Boone breathes in the last of his monstrous condition, and bends to tenderly stroke Lori's face. Then, very lightly, he kisses her, and gathers her in his arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCENE DELETED 118A. INT. LYLESBURG'S CHAMBER BOONE: I had no choice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You've put us all in danger for your love of this woman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Decker can't tell anyone. What's he going to say? That he tried to kill a girl and a dead man stopped him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : He can still lead our enemies here. If he goes - if Midian's unearthed  you're responsible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : So let me make amends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Just take the girl and go on your way amongst the Naturals. That's the Law.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Who made this Law?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Baphomet. The God in Obsidian. Who made Midian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : So maybe I should speak to this guy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Baphomet is a spirit in stone. He doesn't speak, or move. His wounds are too great...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : What are you afraid of?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : What Baphomet made he has the power to unmake. His blood is volatile. He mustn't be angered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Then I'll make nice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCENE DELETED 120. INT. CORRIDOR BY LYLESBURG'S CHAMBER NIGHT Boone heads down the corridor. He slows as he passes an entrance to one side chamber and looks in... Inside the chamber, a dog-faced man is working on a vast elaborate mosaic mural that extends into shadow in both directions. He looks up and locks eyes with Boone. Boone breaks off the contact and continues down the corridor. The dog-faced man turns back to his palette; a multi-coloured collection of small tiles. He carefully selects a few, then turns to the mosaic and we see...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. MURAL CHAMBER NIGHT The mosaic mural. Prominent in what appears to be a panoramic visual history of the Nightbreed race, is a heroic figure who closely resembles...Boone. The dog-faced man applies the tiles he's selected, filling in the irises of the Boone-figure's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. RACHEL'S CHAMBER Lori sits up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Boone...? Her head aches. She winces. Babette goes to her aid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Be still. It was a bad hurt he did us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Us? What do you mean 'us'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [moving to them]: You held Babette while she transformed. She's made quite a bond with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I felt your hurt. I still feel it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : She even knew you were coming here. She saw it all, through your eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : And you can see through mine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [pause - she tries to read Rachel]: You're not kidding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : It's true. Lori rises unsteadily to her feet. Babette takes her hand, but Rachel moves her away from Lori.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: She doesn't want you to touch her, sweet. She's afraid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You got that right. One minute I'm about to get carved like a Christmas turkey, the next I'm...I'm...[a surfacing memory breaks her train]...God...it was Boone...Boone saved me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : But he's dead, I saw him in the morgue...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You still don't understand, do you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Wait a second, back up...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You're below now. With the Nightbreed. The last survivors of the great tribes. LORI: Tribes of who? What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : We're shapeshifters; freaks; remains of races your species have almost driven to extinction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : So you're not immortal?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Far from it. The sun can kill some of us. Like Babette. She follows her father in that. Some of us could be shot down; others would survive that because they've got beyond death.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Horrible. It's all horrible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : To be able to fly? To be smoke, or a wolf; to know the night, and live in it forever? That's not so bad. You call us monsters, but when you dream, it's of flying and changing, and living without death. You envy us. And what you envy...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [softly; understanding]: ...We destroy...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [to Babette]: Show her. Show her the past... Babette touches Lori's arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Be with me. The skulls in front of Lori fill her sight. We fly through one of the eye sockets into...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCENE DELETED 123A. LORI/BABETTE'S VISION [TORTURE SEQUENCE] Fade through from the skull chamber into grinning people running towards partially constructed bonfires...The people throw tinder onto the fires...We track off the fire-building to a wall, behind where frightened monsters hide...The shadow of a cross falls on them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LORI/BABETTE'S VISION [TORTURE SEQUENCE] Inquisitors in black robes part to reveal the Head Inquisitor in purple robes... He reads the charges...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Thou shalt not suffer a monster to live...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LORI/BABETTE'S VISION [TORTURE SEQUENCE] Frightened monsters pulled away from the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LORI/BABETTE'S VISION [TORTURE SEQUENCE] Inquisitors step aside to show torture scenes. We track through the tortures: racks, crucifixion, floggings, a hanging. The camera moves off gallows, past a wall to flags. We cut close on the flag which reads FREAK SHOW, track past the flag to a cage, containing freakish Breed. Well-dressed ordinary men and women applaud and laugh. One of the freaks is dragged from the cages. He looks back at the family he's left behind. The inquisitor reads their charges, as the bonfire awaits. The Victim is thrown onto the bonfire. A tinder flares, and the inquisitors and audience light cigarettes and cigars from the tinder. The bonfire then flares up. An inquisitor lasciviously strokes the naked buttocks of a beautiful girl. She turns towards us in despair; we see her head is bestial.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. RACHEL'S CHAMBER Overwhelmed with horror, Lori opens her eyes, breaking her connection with Babette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : We are all that remain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : And...and you're saying...Boone's like you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : He is Nightbreed. Or he was, until he broke the Law.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [moving towards the door]: No, no, that's not possible - I've got to find him, there's been some kind of mistake...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Don't go...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : But he didn't kill anybody, it wasn't him, he's innocent...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : That no longer matters...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Where is he? Where'd he go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Down to the Tabernacle, to Baphomet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The Baptiser. Who made Midian. Who called us here and saved us from our enemies...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Take me there, I've got to find Boone...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : It's forbidden.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : We'll see about that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. EIGERMAN'S OFFICE Decker is drinking coffee. A cop strides by. Joyce enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Decker? This better be good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I found Boone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Someone brought the corpse down here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : He's not dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I saw him pumped full of bullets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : So did I. But he's alive. He killed again...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : In Shere Neck?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : No, out at Midian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Why'd he go back there? Eigerman enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : What are you doing in my office?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : This is Inspector Joyce. Calgary Police Department.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : We don't need any city boys on the case. Midian's under my jurisdiction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : We can work together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : No we don't. I'll bring him in myself. This is my town.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : He's not alone anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Yeah. I heard that talk. That's nuthouse talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Talk about what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Midian's not empty. There's something breeding there. Below the cemetery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Bullshit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [to Decker]: Do you believe that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Yes I do. And if you don't stop them there's going to be more bloodshed. I promise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCENE DELETED 127. INT. MIDIAN CENTRAL CORE Lori finds herself in a cavernous space, lined with chambers connected by walkways and ladders, which don't look particularly secure. She moves out on to a walkway. It leads her into the central core of Midian, which offers a view of dizzying descent into the earth. She scans the scene, amazed by the sheer scale of the place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : My God... As she descends into the bowels of Midian, creatures in various doorways watch her with curiosity. One creature seems to have light running from wounds on its body. Another tumbles past her, a slow acrobat, defying gravity. She sees only a few of these but hears far more, chattering and murmuring in the shadows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. MIDIAN CORE As Lori moves through the chambers toward Peloquin we see the devil creature Lude feeding snakes to his pet, a horned, many legged beast which squats on the floor. He gets up and goes to look at her. Leroy, a grinning grotesque, appears from the back of the chamber, snatches the snake from the maw of the pet, and comes to watch as well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [eating the snake]: There goes the neighbourhood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCENE DELETED 128A. INT. MIDIAN CENTRAL CORE Lori looks into a chamber. A dark, winged figure moves aside to reveal... A ceremony, with the bowls of white blood later seen in Baphomet's chamber, is in progress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. MIDIAN CENTRAL CORE As Lori crosses the bridge something watches from the deep shadows...the tone darkens. She steps off the bridge and scorpions scuttle away. Lori is now a little nervous. She finds herself in a corner with several doors...Through one door she sees a man with a white T-shirt. She calls after him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Boone? Lori enters through the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. MIDIAN CHAMBER In a corner a ghastly meal is underway. The Boone figure is heading away through another door. Lori follows the figure, and the diners get up as if to attack. In the next chamber is a tangle of bright red glistening bodies with no heads...Lori glances round. The diners pursue her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. MIDIAN CHAMBER Up ahead of Lori is the Boone figure. She approaches it as it steps out of the shadows... It is not Boone!! She steps away...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. MIDIAN CHAMBER The red beast is rising behind her. Lori turns and exits the chamber, flattening herself against the rock. She advances. Crouched in a niche above where she's walking, we see a small lizard-like creature, Barabas, eating a dead rat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. MIDIAN CHAMBER Lori enters the final chamber, following the figure she thinks is Boone. On the far side, crouching at a door, a figure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Boone? The figure turns. It's Peloquin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : No-one here of that name. She turns. The Boone figure is in the doorway behind her. He has the face of a snake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Told you! He approaches Lori.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I know you. He talks about you. Lori. He snatches a broach from her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Nice. You're still a Natural. Want to join the family? [he goes to bite her]
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : No! Peloquin follows her to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [at door]: You will. Sooner or later you'll want to live forever. He laughs maniacally, returning into his room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. MIDIAN CENTRAL CORE Lori continues her descent. As she nears the cavern floor, Lylesburg steps into her path, beside him his fool, Ohnaka.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You may go no further.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I want Boone!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You're not to blame, but you must understand: what Boone's done has put us in jeopardy...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : No problem, you tell me where he is and we're outta here...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Boone has gone to Baphomet. He is beyond recall. A low rumbling issues from somewhere deep inside the passage Lylesburg stands before. Underneath the rumble is an animal moaning with pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Where is he? He's down here isn't he? You want to stop me you're gonna have to kill me. Impressed by her resolve, Lylesburg stands aside. She moves past him and heads down into the chamber, towards a distant light. Lylesburg gestures after her. Ohnaka nods and follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. BERSERKERS' CORRIDOR ANTECHAMBER Lori heads through a room which leads towards the Berserkers. The reassuring sounds of the Core fade behind her. She slows her advance. Suddenly, Narcisse steps from the shadows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Up and about already?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Keep away from me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I'm sorry about upstairs. I see a pretty face and I want to kiss it. [Lori moves on past] Don't go down there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [instant change of subject]: Don't you just love this place? Shangri-La on dope. I love it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : What's that smell?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [sniffs his armpits]: Not me. They keep the Berserkers down there. Mad bastards. They'll rip your head off and shit down your neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Boone went this way, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : And won't be coming back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I'll bring him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You think love can raise the dead?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : He's not dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : He's that and more. If you don't believe me, you wait 'til he gets to sniff a little blood. That'll bring out the beast in him. I'm telling you, don't go...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I have to. Nothing makes any sense without him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Sense? Who needs it? Lori moves off down the corridor. Ohnaka follows her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [to Ohnaka]: Love those tattoos.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCENE DELETED 131. SCENE DELETED 132. INT. BERSERKERS' CORRIDOR Lori starts down the corridor, the walls of which are cracked wide in places, the gaps covered with chains. From the other side she hears grunts and growls. Then, to her shock, one of the Berserkers' arms reaches up from a grille in the floor and snatches at her leg. She steps aside to avoid it, and another of the Berserkers' arms reaches through the mesh of chains, taking hold of her by the neck. It starts to choke her. She shouts for help. Ohnaka, Lylesburg's fool, appears from down the corridor. He starts to rattle the chains further along the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Hey, Ghost! Hey, Slaughter! Come and get me! Come and get me! The arm around Lori's neck releases its hold, and we hear the sound of the creatures moving along the walls in Ohnaka's direction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Fat-asses! Suddenly, arms reach for him through the chains. He steps away just in time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Missed! He grins at Lori, proud of himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Where's Boone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : This way! He starts to lead her towards Baphomet's chamber.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. OUTSIDE BAPHOMET'S CHAMBER Ohnaka and Lori reach the next to last chamber; a roaring from below, down a slope in front of them, walls vibrating with the din from Baphomet's chamber. Ohnaka withdraws. Blindingly bright light, out of which Lori spots a figure climbing towards them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Boone? Boone! She moves down to Boone, scrambling up the slope towards her, drenched in sweat, half-mad with terror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Don't...don't look... He reaches for her, then collapses. She starts down the slope to him. Dust falls from the roof, the din makes her reel. But she reaches him, starts to haul him to his feet. Then, she looks up and we get a glimpse of...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. BAPHOMET'S CHAMBER Out of the blinding light, and seemingly the source of it, a huge, black figure turns towards her, twelve feet high, severed limbs connected by sinews of hot, white energy and extruded spines, the face terrible, wise and beautiful. Lori's stunned, she averts her eyes. Boone collects himself enough to pull her away and they help each other frantically scrabble up the slope, out of the chamber.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. OUTSIDE BAPHOMET'S CHAMBER As Lori and Boone emerge, Ohnaka appears and beckons them to follow. Too exhausted and frightened to speak, Boone and Lori follow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. MIDIAN CENTRAL CORE Ominous rumblings urge them on, as Boone and Lori make a stumbling ascent through the core, trailing Ohnaka's urgent lead, watched from the doorways by a variety of creatures. We cut to the ledge, and move to a chamber, where Peloquin and Shuna Sassi are making love. Peloquin hears Lori urging Boone on as they struggle across the bridge, and looks away from Shuna, out through the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Well, well... He goes to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: Guess he couldn't take the heat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I dreamt him. He's strong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : That's only because the bite was mine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : No, don't you see? He's the one from the prophesies. Cabal. The seventh saviour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : So why's he leaving?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Everything has its purpose. Maybe he hasn't learned to hate his tribe enough. He'll be back. Peloquin kisses her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Why die waiting?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NECROPOLIS DAY The sun climbs over the horizon, sunlight penetrates the graveyard. A mausoleum door creaks open, Lori and Boone rush out into the open air. Lori tries to lead Boone away, he squints painfully against the early light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : No, no, I belong here...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [grabs him]: Bullshit! Boone, Boone, listen to me - you belong with me, that's why you lived, that's why we survived, because we belong together... Ohnaka swings the door shut behind them. Boone sees Lori, as if for the first time. She takes his hand, presses it to her face, her breast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: This is me. This is why I followed you, this is what we're living for. His eyes clear. A part of him seems to return. He embraces her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Lori...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : They don't need you. Nobody needs you but me. We'll go away, far away, where no-one will ever find us. I love you. They hold each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NECROPOLIS DAY LONG ANGLE: Boone and Lori - two small figures, alone among the sepulchres. They move towards the gate together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. SWEETGRASS INN DAY Empty streets. No activity. Lori's car pulls into the parking lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. LORI'S CAR DAY Lori turns to Boone, slumped down in the passenger seat, out of sight, wearing sunglasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I'll get my stuff, I'll be back in two minutes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Don't leave me alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Boone...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [fiercely]: No!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [calmly  trying to hide her alarm]: Okay. We'll go in together. She hands him the Buffalo Days hat and opens the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. PHONE BOOTH DAY From a phone booth across the street we see Lori and Boone move towards the motel entrance. In foreground, a chain-mailed hand picks up the phone and dials.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. SWEETGRASS INN DAY Boone and Lori enter the corridor that leads to her room. Eerie silence, save for a dog yapping somewhere. Boone stops. Alarmed, she turns to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [whispers]: What's wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Why is it so empty?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : They must be at the rodeo. She hurries on, Boone follows, clearly disturbed. Lori unlocks her door, glancing back at Boone, who has taken off his sunglasses. There is something strange about the light in his eyes. A subtle wave of colour passes across his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I smell blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : So much blood... She swings the door open. We expect a horror. Nothing. An ordinary room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : It's okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. MOTEL LORI'S ROOM DAY Lori enters and quickly gathers her belongings together. Boone, sweating with terror, slides down the wall into a squatting position. As Lori packs, she looks down, sees a hole in the wall, the result of some massive violence from the other side. She cautiously leans down, peers through the hole and quickly retreats, hand over mouth, horrified by what she's seen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Boone? Boone appears at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: Next door. Boone goes next door and turns the handle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCENE DELETED 145. INT. MOTEL MURDER ROOM DAY Boone pushes the door open. Inside, a massacre: five dead card players, propped up around a poker table in a sick parody of a poker game tableau; throats slit, Buffalo Hats on their heads. Sitting in the middle of the table, a tall, elaborate house of cards. Boone moves into the middle of the room. On his face we can see the hunger he feels. Ripples of color begin to move over his features. He moves towards the corpses...as he does so, we hear a nearly deafening sound from outside...the vibrations knock over the house of cards and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. SWEETGRASS INN DAY Into the empty street, a helicopter descends, discharging Lieutenant Joyce and a platoon of heavily armed Swat Team cops. Local police cars pour in. Captain Eigerman climbs out of his cruiser to survey the siege. Decker introduces him to Joyce. Sharpshooters take up positions, training their weapons on the motel, as the Swat Team moves in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. MOTEL CORRIDOR DAY Lori moves to the door of the murder room. Boone is inside, his back to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : It was Decker...Decker did this... In foreground, Boone's face begins to transform, which Lori can't see. She hears the cops outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: Boone, we have to get out of here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Stay away from me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Boone, what is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I don't want you to see...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : See what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Get out! Do as I say!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I won't leave you... As she crosses towards him, he turns. His face is in mid- transformation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. SWEETGRASS INN DAY Lori's scream echoes outside the motel. Joyce orders in the Swat Team. They charge, entering the motel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. MOTEL CORRIDOR DAY Lori backs out of the room in horror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Oh my God...oh my God... She hears cops charging up the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: Boone! They're coming!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MOTEL MURDER ROOM DAY The transformed Boone covers his face, slams the room door shut and moves towards the bodies. Lori hides at the end of the corridor as the Swat cops appear at the far end. On his knees, in the middle of some frenzied action we can't quite see, Boone stops and looks down at his blood-stained hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : No...No... Out of sight, Lori watches the cops prepare to storm the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. MOTEL BATHROOM DAY Boone enters the bathroom with the sound of the Swat Team's entry to the motel on the track. He slams the door. There is blood on his face and hands. He goes to the sink and turns on the tap. Then he sees himself in the mirror, his transformed face is a shock, He looks at himself, appalled. Then a wave of nausea overtakes him. He throws up into the sink; a splash of blood and flesh he's just eaten. Wiping his mouth with the back of his hands he starts to breathe out his condition. His face transforms back to his normal state. He makes a sob of horror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.): In here! Boone looks towards the door, sinking down against the tiles as he does so. The door is flung open. We see him cowering as the Swat Team come for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCENE DELETED 152. EXT. SWEETGRASS INN DAY Under cover of the trees and cars around the motel, Lori hides in a place where she can view the front of the building. She sees Eigerman talking with Joyce, Decker behind them. They look up as the Swat cops manhandle a hand-cuffed Boone out of the building. He has totally reverted to human form, the blood-stains seemingly a sure proof of guilt. Lori watches as he's thrown into a police car and driven off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. SHERE NECK POLICE STATION DAY A clank of keys opening locks. A steel door swings open. Three cops rough-house Boone down the corridor, Eigerman right behind, passing other cells holding prisoners watching them go by. We hold on one, a young fundamentalist Baptist preacher, Reverend Ashberry. He has haunted, maniacally repressed eyes and the ragged look of a habitual drunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. POLICE STATION CELL DAY Boone is thrown into the cell. Eigerman and the three cops, Labowitz, Sergeant Pettine and Gibbs, all practised hard guys, enter the cell after him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Fuckin' freak! Fuckin' cannibal! [to his men] Stand him up! They haul Boone to his feet. Eigerman hits Boone with a wicked blackjack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: You picked the wrong town, boy. We believe in real justice here, [a blow is delivered] They're gonna take you back to the city...[another blow]...but we're gonna leave you with something...[another blow]...to remember...[another]...us...by! Boone sags to the ground, unconscious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. ASHBERRY'S CELL DAY As the sound of Boone being beaten up filters through the wall, Ashberry sits in his cell, Bible in hand. He flicks the pages over, attempting to distance himself from the violence he hears with study. He halts at a page with an illustration. It is something from Revelations: monsters and demons doing battle with angels. He puts the book down, and turns over his palm. It is a mass of tiny scars. He closes his hand into a white-knuckled fist, retreating into the shadows in the corner of his cell. We cutback to his hand. Blood seeps between the fingers, as his nails dig into the meat of his palm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. EIGERMAN'S OFFICE DAY Eigerman enters. Decker is standing looking at Eigerman's collection of photographs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You still here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I'm going back to Midian with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I'm not going anywhere. We got press folks and photographers coming in from all over. Wouldn't be polite to keep 'em waiting. Eigerman starts to exit again. Joyce is in the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Tell him. We got our man under lock and key.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Don't trust him. He...he...changes. I've seen him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I'll keep an eye out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : He was right about the motel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : So?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : So maybe there are more of them...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Monsters?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Killers. A cult. I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You want to take some of the boys, take 'em Pettine?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Yes, Sir -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You, Tommy and Gibbs, take the Inspector out to the cemetery. Dig around. If you find anything with more two eyes, holler. I got photographers wanting me... He exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. BOONE'S CELL DAY Badly beaten, Boone lies in the corner, stirring when he hears the door unlocked. Labowitz ushers in a middle-aged, small-town physician, Doctor Rose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Doctor's here to examine you, freak. Just so nobody can say we laid a finger on you...[he winks at Rose] Looks okay to me, what do you think, Doc? Boone painfully pulls himself upright. Looks up at Dr Rose, who slips on his stethoscope, listens to Boone's chest. He moves it, listens, moves it again, alarmed. He takes Boone's wrist, feels around. Boone stares at him. Dr Rose clears his throat, rises, moves to Labowitz at the door and speaks quietly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : No pulse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : What's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : No...pulse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. POLICE STATION DAY A crowd of journalists and on-lookers mill outside the station. We find Lori, following her through the crowd as she tries to get a view of the building. As she watches, Joyce and his three-cop escort climb into two police cars and drive off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. POLICE STATION DAY An impromptu press conference, with Eigerman centre stage, standing at a table laced with tape recorders and microphones. Behind him, a map of the town, with coloured pins and a blackboard drawing of the Sweetgrass Inn, including a diagram of where the bodies were found. Eigerman adores the attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Yes he may have had accomplices but I can't reveal the precise source of my information on that...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Local source, Captain?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [a glance at Decker in the crowd]: Not so's you'd notice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Has Boone made a confession?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : We found him with a piece of human flesh in his mouth. How's that for guilty? Cameras flash furiously. We see Labowitz leading Dr Rose through the crowd to the podium. Labowitz reaches Eigerman and whispers in his ear. Eigerman makes him repeat it. His brow knits in puzzlement. He turns to the press and smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: 'Scuse me, folks, won't be a second. Eigerman points a beckoning finger at Decker, who follows him into his office, along with Labowitz and Dr Rose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. EIGERMAN'S OFFICE DAY Eigerman closes the door and turns to Decker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Just exactly how many bullets did they put into this geek up at Midian?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [severely shaken]: Half of them are still in him. In fact, he's riddled with them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : As I told you, these aren't ordinary people. You're saying he should be dead?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : No, I'm saying he is dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : When?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Not lying down dead, friend. Walkin' around in my fucking cell dead. Now what about that? Decker's shaken. He grips his briefcase tightly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. BOONE'S CELL DAY Boone sits in his cell, head down, expression masked, eyes moving restlessly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. ASHBERRY'S CELL DAY Ashberry is sitting half in shadow and half in light. His eyes carry the half-buried mania that we'll see erupt later on. He puts his head against the wall and speaks softly to Boone, his tone intensifying as his feelings take stronger hold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Can you hear me? They'll find a way to kill you, you know that? Can't fight the darkness. Not when it's inside you. Are you listening? You're an abomination, Boone. You have to die. There's lots of ways. I've read about them. Seen them when I sleep. Horrible. HEAR ME? He suddenly slams his bloody hand against the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Have you got a God, Boone? Any God'll do. I had one, but...he doesn't listen any more. I ask him to take the dreams away but they keep coming. Blood and fire. Like the end of the world... We move from Ashberry's stricken face to the bloody mark his hand left in the wall. It vaguely resembles something we recognize: Baphomet's head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. SHERE NECK STREET DAY Lori emerges from a supermarket with food to eat. She walks into a small square, finds a seat and sits down to eat. As she reaches into the bag:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [V.O.]:Lori? She looks round. The voice sounded real. No sign of Babette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [V.O. - cont.]: Lori...close your eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [frightened]: Where are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [V.O.]: Please, do as I say. Lori closes her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. SKULL CHAMBER CENTRE CORE Lori and Babette's P.O.V. - darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [V.O.]: Be with me...be with me... Dim light. We're in the Midian skull chamber, seeing it through Babette's eyes. Their voices merge into one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [V.O.]: ...where am I? What's happening to me? Rachel steps into view, and looks directly down at the camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : What is it, child?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. SHERE NECK STREET DAY Lori's eyes spring open. She's terrified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [V.O.]: Lori! Comeback! Lori closes her eyes again and we click back into...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. SHERE NECK STREET DAY Lori and Babette's P.O.V. - we see Babette's view of Rachel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [V.O.]: Is this real?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [whispers]: What are you talking about? Babette? [grips Babette] What have you done?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [V.O.]: I've brought her, to see. She's in me. Babette breaks away, Rachel tries to catch hold, Babette runs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: camera veers around and down through the maze of Midian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. SHERE NECK STREET DAY Eyes closed on the bench, Lori gasps as the journey snatches her up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. CENTRAL CORE Lori and Babette's P.O.V. - Babette races over a rope-bridge. We see it all through her eyes, her hands coming occasionally into view. We head down a narrow tunnel and into a small chamber, which is Babette's hidehole. We scan the treasures she keeps there: a doll made of grasses; birds' skulls; pretty stones. We hear voices from above and we look up at a steel grille, facing out on the surface.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NECROPOLIS DAY Pushing closer to the grille we see...Joyce, Pettine, Tommy and Gibbs, wandering through the Necropolis, armed to the hilt. Only Joyce carries no weapon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Christ, you could hide a fuckin' army in here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : What egg-zactly are we lookin' for, Sarge?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [spits some tobacco juice on a tomb]: We're here to kick some major-league butt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [distrusts these throwbacks]: We're here to scout, not engage
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Well what if they engage us? What about that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : There's people down there, I can feel it. Lori/Babette gasps, Pettine hears the sound and walks over to the grille.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Why don't we just shoot 'em in their graves? Save us diggin' new ones, [giggles - fires at one of the tombs]
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [angry]: Hold your fire!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : We want prisoners, Tommy. Pettine goes down on his haunches beside the grille, runs the muzzle of his gun along it. P.O.V. camera withdraws into the shadows. He shakes his head and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NECROPOLIS DAY We cut out of the P.O.V. as Pettine stands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : There's something down there all right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : If that's the case we'll call for back-up... Pettine spots a movement in the shadows of a half-open mausoleum door. He catches Gibbs' eye, nods in the direction of the door, Gibbs gets the idea and starts to back towards the tomb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [a performance]: I don't know. Maybe we're just spooked. Hell, who'd live in a graveyard, anyway? [crossing towards Gibbs] What do you say, Lieutenant? Maybe we oughta just pack it in...head for home... He and Gibbs rush the door of the tomb; there's a cry of surprise from inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NECROPOLIS DAY Lori and Babette's P.O.V. - Camera glides back up to the grille in time to see Gibbs and Pettine drag Ohnaka out of darkness and into the sunlight where he lacks the strength to resist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Well, lookee what we got here... Tommy strikes Ohnaka with a rifle butt, knocking him to his knees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NECROPOLIS DAY As the cops circle around Ohnaka, he moans, puts his head down and covers his face with his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Shit. Don't look so tough to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Want we should interrogate it, Lieutenant?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [amazed]: Give it some room. In the sunlight, Ohnaka's naked back begins to smoke and blister.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : What the hell for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : God damn it! There's something wrong with him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [disgusted]: Shit...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : What the fuck is this? Gibbs, unfazed, steps up to Ohnaka and kicks the creature over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : We want answers, asshole!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Back off, Gibbs! Gibbs ignores him, trying to drag Ohnaka's hands away from his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NECROPOLIS DAY Lori and Babette's P.O.V. - Watching the knot of men around the defenceless Ohnaka.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [V.O.]: The light...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NECROPOLIS DAY Gibbs rifle-butts Ohnaka's hands, then pulls them away from his face; the features are horribly disfigured, blood running from his eyes, scorched by the sun. Now even Gibbs tries to back away, but Ohnaka grabs hold of his shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Shit! Shit! Get it off me! Tommy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : No way, man! Pettine fires his piece at Ohnaka, hitting him in the belly and arm, but he still holds on, throwing back his head and howling. Smoke rises from his entire body, dust pours from his veins. The howl becomes a high-pitched whine and he explodes, in a burst of dust and black blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NECROPOLIS DAY Lori and Babette's P.O.V. - They see Ohnaka die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. SHERE NECK STREET DAY Lori opens her eyes, which are running with tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Oh my God...oh my God... She stands up, her hand to her mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NECROPOLIS DAY Lori and Babette's P.O.V. - Babette's trembling hands hold onto the grille as she watches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [V.O.]: Lori, don't leave, please don't leave me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NECROPOLIS DAY The cops stare in disbelief at Ohnaka's dusty remains.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Jesus...d'you see that fucker's face?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : It was the sun. The sun did it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Christ on a crutch...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Man, that tears it, I'm calling the fuckin' chief. Gibbs raises a trembling match to his cigarette as Tommy heads back to the cars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Couldn't have been just...just the sun...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Believe it, shithead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [grinning]: So if all it takes is the sun, we got the perfect weapon, right over our heads.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Until it goes down. Pettine's smile fades. Then a cry of alarm from the distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [V.O.]: Oh no! Shit! Pettine! Goddamn it! The men rush to the gate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NECROPOLIS GATES DAY The two police cars are on fire. The other cops reach them, Pettine reaches into the one less involved in flame and pulls out the radio microphone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Who did it, did you see anyone? Tommy shakes his head. They all look up, hearing a distant car engine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT./INT. BEAT-UP CAR DAY Wearing a hat and dark glasses, laughing, Narcisse drives this old clunker like a maniac, takes a large cigar out of his mouth. He strikes a match off a thumb hook and lights up. In the back, protected from sunlight by shades on the windows, is Rachel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. POLICE STATION TOILET DAY The door opens, a panicked Labowitz enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Chief, come quick...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [from inside a stall]: This better be good...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Pettine's on the radio, they're under attack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Hot damn, we got contact! He bursts out of the stall, hitching his trousers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. EIGERMAN'S OFFICE DAY Eigerman enters, takes the two-way receiver. Behind him, Decker, Labowitz and Kane enter the office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Pettine, what's your situation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NECROPOLIS INT. EIGERMAN'S OFFICE DAY Pettine on the radio, as the others try to keep back the flames.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [into radio]: The place is crawling with 'em...they torched our cars...fuckin' freaks!... The transmission breaks up. Eigerman turns to the others in the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [joyfully]: ...Sound the call, boys, let the bells of freedom ring, we got to mobilize. Decker affectionately runs his hand over his briefcase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. SHERENECK STREET DAY Lori moves down the street, blinking through tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [V.O.]: I'm afraid ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I have to go, Babette, I have to get help. I'll be back, I promise. You hide somewhere. The connection fades. Lori wipes the tears from her cheeks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. POLICE STATION DAY The crowd and journalists still hanging around; Eigerman throws the door open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Listen up! We got officers under attack, I need volunteers for a posse! Y'all sign up with Officer Labowitz here! He moves back towards the office, as Labowitz, clipboard in hand, is besieged with offers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. EIGERMAN'S OFFICE DAY Decker is sitting with his briefcase open on his lap, gazing
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: at the button head mask inside. He snaps the case shut as Eigerman re-enters, followed by the silent Kane. Eigerman digs a key out of his desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : If you're gonna make an omelette you have to break eggs, isn't that right, Professor?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [doesn't follow]: Sorry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Christmas comes early this year.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. POLICE STATION STORAGE ROOM DAY Eigerman leads Decker, Kane and another cop down into the bowels of the station. He unlocks a door and switches on a light. Warehoused inside is a virtual arsenal in a number of packing crates stencilled with a martial insignia and the name:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : SHERE NECK BRIGADE' The crates are also stamped with their countries of origin: South Africa and the Soviet Union.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Ounce a' prevention is worth a pound a' cure. Save for a rainy day, one day that day will come. Don't matter if it's Commies, homos, freaks or Japs, we are ready. World class ordnance, Doc: the best private sector money can buy. Kane, with a clipboard, goes over supplies with the other cop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [over above  in his element): Okay. We got your spankin' new
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: thirty-odd-six Springfield semi-auto with roller-lock action and retractable stock. For standard carbine firepower, you can't beat this match-accurate Galil AR 7.62 NATO assault rifle and for the sportsman in the crowd we carry this handy, double-pump, Mossberg Persuader, sling swivels double extractors, which also comes in a light-weight single-barrel size for ladies and juniors -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Marvelous, really, but -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Now over here we're talkin' Damascus, high-carbon Spetnatz shootin' knives, and for that tough up-close-and- personal work, you can always count on your razor-wire/fishing-line garotte when nuthin' else will do DECKER [over Kane]: Captain, have you considered the possibility that knives and bullets won't be adequate to the task?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Show him, Kane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [pulling off a shroud to unveil]: That's why we bought these cherry Israeli Army high-octane linear-field flame throwers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Now I know what you're thinkin', Doc; maybe there's some sort'a spiritual angle to all this. Well, we got that covered, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. POLICE STATION CELLS NIGHT A cell door swings open. Decker and Eigerman look in on the Baptist preacher, Reverend Ashberry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Reverend Ashberry, your services are required.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : He looks like a drunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : He is; lost his way, poor bastard, [hauling Ashberry to his feet] You wouldn't wanna miss the Day of Judgment, now would you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [seems he's been waiting for this]: The Apocalypse? It's here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : They're warming up for it over in Midian. [leading him out] Padre, you get your pious butt over to church and load up on some Holy Water and crucifixes...we're goin' in there with God on our side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. POLICE STATION DAY Boone looks out the window of his cell as a large, unruly posse musters outside in a variety of vehicles. A mix of survivalist fanatics in Sons of the Free-labelled camouflage, Marlboro Men with six-shooters, red-neck bozos with their diesel-dyke mamas and heavily made-up bimbos out for a good time. The atmosphere is one of near carnival. Accoutred for combat, Kane and some other cops distribute the weapons. Boone slumps away from the window, his worst fears realized. Reverend Ashberry arrives, lugging six full canteens and an arm-load of crucifixes. He loads into the back of an enclosed, high-tech camper with Eigerman and Decker. Eigerman blows an air-horn, claiming the crowd's attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You are all hereby deputized in the name of the law. Now let's kick some ass! Eigerman's truck leads the caravan, which drives off, horns honking, war whoops and liquor-fuelled courage. As the dust clears now, left more or less alone, Lori looks at the police station. A beat-up car squeals to a halt in front of her and the front door opens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Hey, chickie, want a ride?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Please. Lori sees Rachel and gets in the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. BEAT-UP CAR DAY Narcisse drives around the block, smoking his cigar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : We have to get Boone out, Midian needs him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : What could he do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : He went into Baphomet's chamber. He spoke with the Baptiser...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : And survived; nobody ever did that before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Perhaps Baphomet told him something, something that could save Midian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Where they keeping him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Inside somewhere. He'll be guarded.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : He has powers of his own.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Tell me about it; what's happened to him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : He was bitten by a Nightbreed, see, the taint's in his system...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Boone has been turned, he's one of us...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Okay. So what you're saying is, you're saying he's dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Hey, some of my best friends are dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [horrified]: ...I'm going out of my mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [to Rachel]: See? I told you she'd take it well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. HIGHWAY DAY The posse heads down the road, whoops and hollers emerging from the dust cloud it kicks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. CAB OF EIGERMAN'S TRUCK DAY Eigerman cleans his silver-plate Magnum .45, Decker sits beside him holding his briefcase, across from Ashberry, who's frantically paging through an ancient Bible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Ever performed an exorcism, Father?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Ever seen one?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Well I'd start rehearsin' if I was you. [hands a gun towards Decker] Why don't you hang on to that, Doc?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [a little prim]: Oh no, I wouldn't know how to use it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [finds something in the book, reads]: Listen! 'So Moses spoke to the people, saying "Arm yourselves for war and let them go and take vengeance for the Lord on Midian..." and so they burned with fire all the cities where they dwelt and killed the kings of Midian, both man and beast!'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [with a wink]: Hey, how 'bout that, Doc? Sounds like we're on a crusade against the Devil himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [not terribly convincing]: I don't believe in the Devil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Oh...you will. Ashberry looks at Decker; no trace of irony in his expression. Ashberry sorts through the canteens, finds the one that doesn't have a white cross on it, opens it and knocks back two fingers of bourbon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. SHERE NECK POLICE STATION DAY The sun sinking low in the sky. The shadows are long.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. POLICE STATION CELL CORRIDOR DAY The station is eerily quiet. Labowitz and an Irish cop, Connie Cormack, guard the cells. Two other cops patrol the end of the corridor. All heavily armed. Labowitz moves to the door of Boone's cell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. BOONE'S CELL DAY The spy-hole cover is open. Boone looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [from other side of door]: Hey, freak-face, we found your pals. They're gonna fry, just like you. Give us a smile now. Boone stares at the floor, depressed, defeated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. CELL CORRIDOR/OFFICE DAY Labowitz chuckles and closes the spy-hole. He walks back down to the coffee station near Eigerman's office, where Cormack is pouring two cups. He takes out a flask, spikes his mug and offers some to Labowitz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Little Irish in your joe, Constable Labowitz?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [a bad brogue]: Don't mind if I do, Constable Cormack. There is a knock on the station door. They look at each other. Cormack picks up his gun and crosses to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Who's there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [O.S.]: Help me, please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : What's wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [O.S.]: Accident. We need help. Cormack decides to unbolt the door. On the step stands Rachel, shrouded in black veils. Only her eyes are visible. They fix Cormack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : What's the problem, lady? She drops the veil. The other half of her face has disappeared into smoke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: What the blazes? Her costume falls to the ground. Her eyes dissolve. As smoke, Rachel blows into the station. Cormack fires through the smoke, yelling as he does so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [running towards the cell]: Hold 'em, Connie!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. CELL CORRIDOR DAY The two other cops hear the shot and run towards the station. Labowitz runs back in with them before they get there, slams and bolts the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [to the other cops]: Hold your ground! [yells through the door] Cormack? You all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. POLICE STATION DAY Cormack turns back towards the door, sees Narcisse, screams and fires twice. Narcisse flips one of the bullets out of his chest with a thumb-nail, then leaps onto Cormack, who manages to shoot himself in the foot. Lori enters, slams the door and locks it. Narcisse squats over Cormack, holds his razor-nails under his chin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Where is he? Where's Boone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Cell f-f-f-five...through the door...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [grins at Lori]: I love a coward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. CELL CORRIDOR DOOR DAY Labowitz and the other cops confidently prepare for a siege.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [calling back to Boone]: Don't think you're getting sprung, freak. No way they get through that door; solid steel, armour-piercing shells wouldn't even make a dent... Smoke seeps through the key-hole, and from beneath the connecting door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: You hear me, freak? No fuckin' way! The smoke from the key-hole begins to form into a face, which floats on a cord of smoke/flesh from the key-hole. The smoke from beneath the door forms into breasts and rib cage, in which a heart beats. Labowitz turns and sees it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: Jesus Christ... He empties his gun through the smoke; the two cops on the other side of the smoke are hit and go down. An arm moves towards Labowitz; so does Rachel's face. Her beauty mesmerizes him. Her naked breasts, which float beneath the head, barely connected to it as yet, enchant him even more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Come closer...I don't want to kill you... Her hand presses Labowitz's rifle aside. Rachel's lips touch him. He doesn't resist, but once his mouth is sealed against hers he can't breathe. He tries to raise the rifle, but she dashes it from his hand. Then she snatches the keys from his belt and breaks the kiss. He falls to his knees, gasping. Her body completed and naked, Rachel unlocks the connecting door, then starts looking for Boone. Behind her, as Labowitz reaches for his gun, Narcisse's hand reaches in and grabs his throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Naughty, naughty. Labowitz looks up into Narcisse's scarred face and faints. Lori steps past Labowitz to the cell Rachel directs her towards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : We don't have much time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I know. Lori unlocks the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. BOONE'S CELL DAY LORI [nervous]: Boone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [wakes]: Stay away from me. I'll hurt you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I don't think so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You know what I did in that room? I'm a goddamn cannibal. Stay away!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : They're going to come for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Let them. Let them find some way to kill me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You can't die. Midian needs you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Midian's just a hole in the ground. It's full of things that should lie down and stay dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : All right. If not for the Breed, then for me. You can't give up on us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You talk like you're one of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Maybe I wish I was. Some little part of me. [she puts her hand on his face] All I know is, I'm not afraid of you. I know I should be, but I'm not. I still want you, whatever you are. And I'm not going to leave you. If they come for you, then they'll have to kill me too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : No!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : So fight. For both of us. For all of us. I don't want to be dust. I want us flesh and blood. Kiss me. I love you. He kisses her. First tentatively, then with great passion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. CELL CORRIDOR DAY Narcisse knocks, calls through the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : What the hell are you doing in there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. BOONE'S CELL DAY Fucking, is the answer. They are wound around each other: licking, biting, gasping. Boone thrusts up into her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Yes...yes!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [to himself]: Jesus. Bastard does better dead than I did alive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. POLICE STATION DAY The connecting door flies open, a rejuvenated Boone and Lori move into the office where Narcisse and Rachel are waiting. Narcisse toys with the unconscious Cormack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Are we going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : About time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Midian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : All right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : It's about time they saw the truth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SCENE DELETED 202. EXT. NECROPOLIS GATES LATE AFTERNOON Gibbs, Joyce, Tommy and Pettine wait outside the gates. Pettine paces. Joyce looks at his watch, moves over to Pettine and speaks quietly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : How long until dark?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Two hours. Two and a half. I told 'em to bring gasoline. We'll burn the bastards out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Has it occurred to you maybe we've got this all wrong? We could be destroying...I don't know, a whole new species.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You saw that fucker below, Lieutenant, same as me. That damn thing was just too weird to live.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Maybe they're just different.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Isn't that enough reason? Joyce stares at him. In background, Tommy starts to holler. Pettine calls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: What is it? Tommy is pointing frantically at a dust cloud in the distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. ROAD TO MIDIAN LATE AFTERNOON A violent cut to the roar of engines as we track with the fast- moving posse. Eigerman stands up out of a skylight in the cab of his truck, eggs on the other vehicles with a rebel war cry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Yee-hah!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NECROPOLIS GATES LATE AFTERNOON As the caravan appears. Ecstasy. Tommy and Gibbs dance a jig together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : It's the fuckin' cavalry! The posse speeds down towards the Necropolis gates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. ROAD TO MIDIAN INT. CAR DUSK Narcisse's beat-up car speeds down the highway towards Midian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : How much further?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : A mile, maybe two... We close in on Rachel, who stares ahead of her, as if in a trance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : We're too late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Hang on! Steering hard, he veers the car off the road and into thick woods. Branches thrash against the windshield.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: This is a shortcut!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NECROPOLIS DUSK The posse is busily at work around the Necropolis, Eigerman and Kane supervising. Some are laying trails of gasoline through the pathways. Others are simply patrolling, guns in hand. There is an air of nervous anticipation. Ashberry comes round a tomb and we follow him down a walkway, staring in awe at the mausoleums and statuary. Looking at a particularly large tomb, Ashberry's eye is captivated by a large, fantastically rendered marble winged angel. He approaches it, reaches up to touch it. The angel, a monster, turns to look at him with sad, impassive gravity. Then we see its shadow on Ashberry's face and hear the slow, thick beating of its wings as it flies off. Ashberry's stunned. He fumbles the top of his bourbon canteen off, takes a long drink, then stops when he sees a load of dynamite taped to the side of the tomb. He follows the wire that leads off it to another dynamite pack on an adjacent tomb and then another. He's panicked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NECROPOLIS DUSK Kane is escorting Eigerman and Pettine down a pathway, pointing out the posse's handiwork.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : ...packets of plastique at every intersection, trip wires outside the biggest tombs, we figure those'll be the major escape routes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : How much longer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Five minutes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [into walkie-talkie]: Let's pull back to the perimeter before we lose the light. We've got movement underground; they're hearing it round the walls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [approaching them from the side]: Captain!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Jesus, not there, STOP. [Ashberry freezes] We got Claymores planted in the rosebushes, Reverend, cut your nuts off faster'n a hedge clipper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : We've made a mistake, there are Angels here, a heavenly host...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You're drunk, asshole. Ashberry dumps the bourbon out of his canteen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : No. Listen to me, it's wrong, it's sacrilege, this is holy ground...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Get the hell up that hill, you pinhead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You brought me here because I'm a man of God.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : That's right; hang round here a couple more minutes, Padre, and you'll be sitting at his left hand. Now get your sorry ass out of the fuckin' way... Eigerman backhands him. Ashberry falls. Eigerman, Kane, Pettine and the other cops begin to pull back. Ashberry looks up, as he hears grindings and growls in the earth. Boone is lifting off the top of a nearby tomb. Ashberry is about to shoot when Narcisse grabs him around the throat, puts a finger to his lips and signals him to be quiet. Narcisse follows Boone into the tomb. The tomb-lid scrapes as it's pushed back into place from beneath. Ashberry starts to pray.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. BELOW MIDIAN Boone and Narcisse move through the panicking underground, creatures fleeing in every direction. Boone sees Lylesburg, trying to keep the panic down, moves towards him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Stay down! Stay where you are, they're waiting for us above...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [intercepting him]: No! if you stay here you'll be slaughtered...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : This is our home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Not anymore...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : We belong here...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Listen to me, old man, the rules change; if you want to live it won't be here and it won't be by your laws... Other creatures have stopped, watching the confrontation. Boone speaks to them as well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.]: If you'want to survive we've got to fight back, we can't hide anymore! [to Lylesburg] What's it gonna be? Lylesburg slumps, acquiescing, unable to refuse Boone's assertions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [cont.] [to Narcisse]: Get the children above ground, find a hiding place...[to the others] Get ready to fight! [to Lylesburg] What about Baphomet? Can he be moved?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Yes. It could be done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : It must be done. Brothers and sisters, it's time to fight!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. CHAMBERS Leroy and Lude listen to Boone on the bridge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You hear what he said?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : What chance have we got? They're armed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [opens jacket]: So am I. Two one-eyed snakes, nesting in Leroy's belly, slide up from his innards and wrap around his neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : They call us monsters, remember? They're afraid of us. Let's give 'em reason.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : It's a long time since I spilled blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : You never lose the knack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. HILL ABOVE THE NECROPOLIS DUSK From this high vantage point, Decker watches the preparations below through binoculars, with the glee of a pyromaniac at a fire-storm. The sun is setting. He stares up at it, squinting into its brightness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [V.O.]: ...I'm waiting...Philip?... Decker looks towards the patrol car parked nearby. The front door is open. On the passenger seat sits his briefcase. Decker quickly crosses to the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Be quiet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [V.O.]: Let me out, Philip. There's going to be bloodshed. I want to see. Decker opens the briefcase. The mask and his knives are laid out inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Ah, that's better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : We can't let anyone see us...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I want to be free!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [V.O.]: Decker? Decker swings round, slamming the case shut, as Joyce approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Lieutenant...[covering flawlessly] You gave me such a start.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Eigerman's invited you to watch from the command post.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Oh, I don't think I'm up to it, really.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : ...I've got a bad feeling about this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Believe me, Lieutenant, whoever or whatever's living down there deserves what's coming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Monsters, you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Unnatural, misbegotten creatures.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : I don't know. The only monsters I've ever seen had a human face. As Joyce looks down at the Necropolis, Decker sneaks an anxious side- long glance at his briefcase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. NECROPOLIS GATES DUSK The final explosives-layers exit, their backs covered by flamethrower and machine-gun-carrying mob members. A distraught Ashberry is the last out. Midian is now completely deserted. Dandelion seeds drift down the walkways, caught in shafts of sunlight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. NECROPOLIS GATES/COMMAND POST DUSK Eigerman, Pettine and Kane, looking at their watches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [a pause  then]: ...T-minus fifteen seconds...ten, nine,eight, seven, six, five, four, three, two, one ...
direction.name: direction
